entry.summary: ...ANOTHER HEAT WAVE LIKELY THIS LATE WEEKEND INTO EARLY NEXT WEEK... entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued June 30 at 10:39AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...FLOODING FROM LAKE DRAINAGE NEAR NUIQSUT... A lake 23 miles west of Nuiqsut is expected to drain rapidly into Judy Creek and Fish Creek sometime in the next two weeks, impacting camps downstream. Water levels are expect to rise 2 to 6 feet over a 12 to 24 hour period once it releases.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued June 30 at 10:49PM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Cooler and Breezy 4th of July Weekend... * Noticeably cooler with high temperatures 5-15 degrees below average Sunday and Monday. Highs in the low to mid 80s are expected in the lower valleys with upper 60s to low 70s in Sierra valleys. This may feel like an abrupt change for many, especially in mountain communities.

entry.title: Severe Weather Statement issued July 01 at 1:56PM EDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...THE SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING FOR CENTRAL FREDERICK COUNTY IN NORTH CENTRAL MARYLAND IS CANCELLED... The storm which prompted the warning has weakened below severe limits, and no longer poses an immediate threat to life or property. Therefore, the warning has been cancelled. However gusty winds and heavy rain are still possible with this thunderstorm.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued July 01 at 8:37AM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...ELEVATED FIRE WEATHER CONDITIONS FOR THE HOLIDAY WEEKEND... Very warm and dry conditions expected over the holiday weekend. An approaching upper level system will bring gusty south to southwest winds Saturday and especially Sunday. The winds in combination with the warm and dry weather will result in elevated fire weather conditions across much of the region.

entry.title: Red Flag Warning issued July 01 at 1:32AM PDT until July 03 at 11:00PM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Trough of low pressure to bring gusty winds through the weekend... .A low pressure trough impacting the west Coast will bring gusty winds to portions of the state over the weekend. The winds and low humidity will allow for critical fire weather conditions to develop Saturday and Sunday for portions of central and eastern Nevada. Little to no rain is expected.

entry.summary: ...Cooler and Breezy 4th of July Weekend... * Noticeably cooler with high temperatures 5-15 degrees below average Sunday and Monday.
